intro: Dorstenia multiformis var. ramosa, commonly known as the branched mountain gumbo, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, fleshy, and often spirally twisted stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
